stems: at the drop of a hat

dt: {bc}the quantity of fluid that falls in one spherical mass
{bc}a dose of medicine measured by drops

dt.t: eye {wi}drops{/wi} for dilating the pupil of the eye

dt: {bc}a {d_link|minute|minute:2} quantity or degree of something nonmaterial or intangible

dt.t: not a {wi}drop{/wi} of meanness in her
hasn't touched a {wi}drop{/wi} of alcohol in three years

dt: {bc}the smallest practical unit of liquid measure
{bc}something that resembles a liquid drop: such as
{bc}a {d_link|pendent|pendent} ornament attached to a piece of jewelry

dt.t: a sudden, short {wi}drop{/wi} in an elevator

dt: {bc}the people or equipment dropped by parachute
{bc}a place or central {d_link|depository|depository} to which something (such as mail, money, or stolen property) is brought for distribution or transmission
{bc}the act of {d_link|depositing|deposit:1} something at such a place
{bc}the distance from a higher to a lower level or through which something drops

dt.t: It's a twenty-foot {wi}drop{/wi} from the top of the fence.

dt: {bc}a slot into which something is to be dropped
{bc}something that drops, hangs, or falls: such as
{bc}a movable plate that covers the keyhole of a lock
{bc}an unframed piece of cloth stage scenery
{bc}the advantage of having an opponent covered {dx_def}see {dxt|cover:1||1b(2)}{/dx_def} with a firearm
usually used in the phrase {it}get the drop on{/it}

dt.t: waiting to get the {wi}drop{/wi} on me

dt: {bc}a move back from the {d_link|line of scrimmage|line of scrimmage} (as in preparation for making a {d_link|forward pass|forward pass})

dros.drp: at the drop of a hat

dt: {bc}as soon as the slightest {d_link|provocation|provocation} is given {bc}{sx|immediately||}

dt.t: loses her temper {it}at the drop of a hat{/it}

dt: {bc}a part so small as to be {d_link|negligible|negligible}

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}dropa{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}tropfo{/it} drop
shortdef: the quantity of fluid that falls in one spherical mass
a dose of medicine measured by drops
a minute quantity or degree of something nonmaterial or intangible

dt: {bc}into a state of confusion, ruin, etc.

dt.t: The discovery has knocked/thrown all our old assumptions {it}into a cocked hat{/it}.

dt: used to say that one person or thing is much better than another

dt.t: The old design was good, but this new one knocks/beats it {it}into a cocked hat{/it}.

shortdef: into a state of confusion, ruin, etc.
—used to say that one person or thing is much better than another
